concept.title: Query workbench [Developer Preview]
concept.shortdesc: The query workbench provides a rich graphical user interface to run N1QL statements and scripts. It provides database developers a convenient way to browse, create, edit and delete data

section.title: Introduction
section.p: Supported platforms The query workbench is supported on Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X platforms.

ol.li: Download the query workbench archive file couchbase-query-workbench_dp1-<os> from "Link".
Extract the query workbench tool and optionally copy the entire folder, couchbase-query-workbench, to a temporary location.
Open a terminal and navigate to the extracted folder.

The query workbench is configured to connect to your local datastore at 127.0.0.0:8091 using the default credentials. If you want to connect to a different datastore, edit the launch-cbq-gui.sh file and update the variable COUCHBASE_URL.
You can access query workbench UI from
